query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
1 «Vergine Madre, figlia del tuo figlio, 2 umile e alta più che creatura, 3 termine fisso d’etterno consiglio,
4 tu se’ colei che l’umana natura 5 nobilitasti sì, che ’l suo fattore 6 non disdegnò di farsi sua fattura.
query.result:
1 “Virgin Mother, daughter of your son, 2 humble and higher than any creature, 3 fixed term of eternal counsel,
4 you are she who the human nature 5 ennobled so, that its maker 6 did not disdain to become its own creation.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
7 Nel ventre tuo si raccese l’amore, 8 per lo cui caldo ne l’etterna pace 9 così è germinato questo fiore.
query.result: 7 In your womb love was rekindled, 8 by whose heat in the eternal peace 9 thus this flower has sprouted.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
10 Qui se’ a noi meridïana face 11 di caritate, e giuso, intra ’ mortali, 12 se’ di speranza fontana vivace.
query.result: 10 Here you are to us a southern face 11 of charity, and down, among the mortals, 12 you are of hope a lively fountain

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
13 Donna, se’ tanto grande e tanto vali, 14 che qual vuol grazia e a te non ricorre, 15 sua disïanza vuol volar sanz’ ali.
query.result: 13 Woman, you are so great and so worthy, 14 that whoever wants grace and does not turn to you, 15 his/her disdain wants to fly without wings.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
16 La tua benignità non pur soccorre 17 a chi domanda, ma molte fïate 18 liberamente al dimandar precorre.
query.result: 16 Your kindness not only assists 17 to those who ask, but many times 18 freely it runs ahead to the asking

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
19 In te misericordia, in te pietate, 20 in te magnificenza, in te s’aduna 21 quantunque in creatura è di bontate.
query.result: 19 In you mercy, in you piety, 20 in you magnificence, in you gathers 21 however much in creature is of goodness.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
22 Or questi, che da l’infima lacuna 23 de l’universo infin qui ha vedute 24 le vite spiritali ad una ad una,
25 supplica a te, per grazia, di virtute 26 tanto, che possa con li occhi levarsi 27 più alto verso l’ultima salute.
query.result:
22 Now these, who from the lowest chasm 23 of the infinite universe here have seen 24 the spiritual lives one by one,
25 they plead to you, for grace, of virtue 26 so much, that they may with the eyes rise 27 higher towards the ultimate salvation.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
28 E io, che mai per mio veder non arsi 29 più ch’i’ fo per lo suo, tutti miei prieghi 30 ti porgo, e priego che non sieno scarsi,
31 perché tu ogne nube li disleghi 32 di sua mortalità co’ prieghi tuoi, 33 sì che ’l sommo piacer li si dispieghi.
query.result:
28 And I, who never for my seeing was not burned 29 more than I do for his, all my prayers 30 I offer you, and I pray that they are not scarce,
31 because you every cloud them untie 32 of his mortality with your prayers, 33 so that the supreme pleasure to them is unfolded

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
34 Ancor ti priego, regina, che puoi 35 ciò che tu vuoli, che conservi sani, 36 dopo tanto veder, li affetti suoi.
query.result: 34 Still I pray to you, queen, that you can 35 that which you will, that you keep healthy, 36 after so much seeing, his affections for them.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
37 Vinca tua guardia i movimenti umani: 38 vedi Beatrice con quanti beati 39 per li miei prieghi ti chiudon le mani!».
query.result: 37 Your guard conquers the human movements: 38 you see Beatrice with how many blessed 39 for my prayers they close their hands to you!

40 The eyes beloved and venerated by God, 41 fixed in the orator, they demonstrated 42 how the devout prayers are dear to them;
43 then to the eternal light they straightened themselves, 44 in which one must not think that it is sent 45 by creature the eye so clear.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
46 E io ch’al fine di tutt’ i disii 47 appropinquava, sì com’ io dovea, 48 l’ardor del desiderio in me finii.
query.result: 46 And I who at the end of all desires 47 was approaching, just as I ought, 48 the ardor of desire in me I ended

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
49 Bernardo m’accennava, e sorridea, 50 perch’ io guardassi suso; ma io era 51 già per me stesso tal qual ei volea:
52 ché la mia vista, venendo sincera, 53 e più e più intrava per lo raggio 54 de l’alta luce che da sé è vera.
query.result:
49 Bernardo gestured to me, and smiled, 50 because I should look upward; but I was 51 already for myself just as he wanted:
52 because my sight, becoming sincere, 53 and more and more entered through the ray 54 of the high light that by itself is true.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
55 Da quinci innanzi il mio veder fu maggio 56 che ’l parlar mostra, ch’a tal vista cede, 57 e cede la memoria a tanto oltraggio.
query.result: 55 From here onward my seeing was May 56 that speech shows, that yields to such sight, 57 and memory yields to such affront.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
58 Qual è colüi che sognando vede, 59 che dopo ’l sogno la passione impressa 60 rimane, e l’altro a la mente non riede,
61 cotal son io, ché quasi tutta cessa 62 mia visïone, e ancor mi distilla 63 nel core il dolce che nacque da essa.
query.result:
58 He who, dreaming, sees, 59 who after the dream the impressed passion 60 remains, and the other does not return to the mind,
61 Thus I am, because almost all ceases 62 my vision, and still it distills to me 63 in the heart the sweet that was born from it.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
64 Così la neve al sol si disigilla; 65 così al vento ne le foglie levi 66 si perdea la sentenza di Sibilla.

Please translate each line literally into English.
67 O somma luce che tanto ti levi 68 da’ concetti mortali, a la mia mente 69 ripresta un poco di quel che parevi,
70 e fa la lingua mia tanto possente, 71 ch’una favilla sol de la tua gloria 72 possa lasciare a la futura gente;
73 ché, per tornare alquanto a mia memoria 74 e per sonare un poco in questi versi, 75 più si conceperà di tua vittoria.

Please translate each line literally into English.
76 Io credo, per l’acume ch’io soffersi 77 del vivo raggio, ch’i’ sarei smarrito, 78 se li occhi miei da lui fossero aversi.
query.result: 76 I believe, for the sharpness that I have suffered 77 of the living ray, that I would be lost, 78 if my eyes from it were turned away.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
79 E’ mi ricorda ch’io fui più ardito 80 per questo a sostener, tanto ch’i’ giunsi 81 l’aspetto mio col valore infinito.
query.result: 79 It reminds me that I was more daring 80 for this to sustain, so that I reached 81 my aspect with infinite value

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
82 Oh abbondante grazia ond’ io presunsi 83 ficcar lo viso per la luce etterna, 84 tanto che la veduta vi consunsi!
85 Nel suo profondo vidi che s’interna, 86 legato con amore in un volume, 87 ciò che per l’universo si squaderna:
88 sustanze e accidenti e lor costume 89 quasi conflati insieme, per tal modo 90 che ciò ch’i’ dico è un semplice lume.
query.result:
82 Oh abundant grace by which I presumed 83 to fix the face through the eternal light, 84 so that I consumed the sight there!
85 In its depth I saw that it is internalized, 86 bound with love in a volume, 87 that which for the universe is dismembered:
88 substances and accidents and their habit 89 almost merged together, in such a way 90 that that which I say is a simple light.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
91 La forma universal di questo nodo 92 credo ch’i’ vidi, perché più di largo, 93 dicendo questo, mi sento ch’i’ godo.
query.result: 91 The universal form of this knot 92 I believe that I saw, because more than wide, 93 saying this, I feel that I enjoy

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
94 Un punto solo m’è maggior letargo 95 che venticinque secoli a la ’mpresa 96 che fé Nettuno ammirar l’ombra d’Argo.
query.result: 94 Only a single point is a greater torpor to me 95 that twenty‑five centuries to the enterprise 96 that made Neptune admire the shadow of Argos

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
97 Così la mente mia, tutta sospesa, 98 mirava fissa, immobile e attenta, 99 e sempre di mirar faceasi accesa.
query.result: 97 Thus my mind, all suspended, 98 stared fixed, immobile and attentive, 99 and always by looking made itself kindled.

100 To that light such one becomes, 101 that to turn from it for another aspect 102 it is impossible that ever it be permitted;
103 however that the good, which is of the will object, 104 all gathers in it, and outside of that 105 is defective that which is perfect there.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
106 Omai sarà più corta mia favella, 107 pur a quel ch’io ricordo, che d’un fante 108 che bagni ancor la lingua a la mammella.
query.result: 106 Now my speech will be shorter, 107 still to that which I remember, that of a foot soldier 108 who still bathes the tongue at the breast.

109 Not because more than a simple appearance 110 was in the living light that I was gazing at, 111 that such is always as it was before;
112 but for the sight that was being strengthened 113 in me looking, a single appearance, 114 changing myself, it troubled me.

115 In the profound and clear subsistence 116 of the high light seemed to me three circles 117 of three colors and of one containment;
118 and one from the other like rainbow from rainbow 119 seemed reflected, and the third seemed fire 120 that from here and therefore equally breathes.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
121 Oh quanto è corto il dire e come fioco 122 al mio concetto! e questo, a quel ch’i’ vidi, 123 è tanto, che non basta a dicer ‘poco’.
query.result: 121 Oh how short is the speaking and how feeble 122 to my concept! and this, to that which I saw, 123 is so much, that it is not enough to say ‘little’.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
124 O luce etterna che sola in te sidi, 125 sola t’intendi, e da te intelletta 126 e intendente te ami e arridi!
127 Quella circulazion che sì concetta 128 pareva in te come lume reflesso, 129 da li occhi miei alquanto circunspetta,
130 dentro da sé, del suo colore stesso, 131 mi parve pinta de la nostra effige: 132 per che ’l mio viso in lei tutto era messo.
query.result:
124 O eternal light that alone in you sit, 125 alone you understand yourself, and from you understood 126 and understanding you love and smile!
127 That circulation that so conceived 128 seemed in you like reflected light, 129 from my eyes somewhat circumspects,
130 inside of itself, of its own colour itself, 131 it seemed painted of our effigy: 132 therefore my face in it all was placed.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
133 Qual è ’l geomètra che tutto s’affige 134 per misurar lo cerchio, e non ritrova, 135 pensando, quel principio ond’ elli indige,
136 tal era io a quella vista nova: 137 veder voleva come si convenne 138 l’imago al cerchio e come vi s’indova;
139 ma non eran da ciò le proprie penne: 140 se non che la mia mente fu percossa 141 da un fulgore in che sua voglia venne.

Please translate each line literally into English.
142 A l’alta fantasia qui mancò possa; 143 ma già volgeva il mio disio e ’l velle, 144 sì come rota ch’igualmente è mossa,
145 l’amor che move il sole e l’altre stelle.
query.result:
142 To the high fantasy here missed may it be possible; 143 but already turned my desire and the will, 144 so as a wheel that equally is moved,
145 the love that moves the sun and the other stars.
